JobFullDesc:
Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

We are looking for a talented product designer who has experience designing visualizations. You have crafted elegant user experiences, worked with design systems, and collaborated with talented product managers and engineers. Come join our distributed team of creatives and help people to make sense of large amounts of data.
Please note that a portfolio is mandatory for consideration. We appreciate your understanding.
This is a distributed role to be located in one of our entity countries including (and in no particular order) USA, Canada, the Netherlands, UK, Germany, France, Switzerland, Sweden, Norway, Spain, Denmark, Hong Kong, South Korea, Japan, Australia, or Singapore. 
What you will be doing: 
Produce wireframes, prototypes, and specificationsWork closely with developers and product managers to ensure that our user experience reflects our collective knowledgeUnderstand the tradeoffs around data visualization, accessibility and aesthetic UI / visual designLeverage user testing and UX research to create data-driven solutionsIterate on interactive data visualization and exploration prototypes with developersProvide design feedback and usage guidelines for a variety of visualization typesGuide the UX for building and configuring visualizations 
What you bring along:
Deep understanding of data visualization design principlesFamiliarity with some popular charting librariesFamiliarity with data exploration interactions and approachesAbility to create elegant and cohesive solutions that solve business challenges and meet user needsConversant in solving data visualization specific goals, eg. choice of color palettes or subtle aspects of data visualizationPortfolio with examples of data visualizations and related user interfacesExperience with the typical product design suite: Figma, SketchAbility to uphold responsiveness and collaboration in a remote environment. You are an organized self starter with strong communication skills. Being part of a distributed team requires proactive communication and sometimes even oversharingPrior experience working in the technology industry. You enjoy learning about new technologies and are able to collaborate with Product Managers and EngineersKnowledge of front-end development (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Canvas)Knowledge about accessibilityFamiliarity with git and able to run an application locallyStay current with the latest design and technology trends and adopt modern techniques as appropriate
Bonus points:
Experience with open source softwareFamiliarity with or experience in visual analytics, eg. in a technical or business domainFamiliarity with research on data visualization and data exploration
